user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_rq_dauth_qop:
```c
static enum MHD_DigestAuthQOP
get_rq_dauth_qop (const struct MHD_RqDAuthParam *const qop_param)
{
  if (NULL == qop_param->value.str)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_NONE;
  if (qop_param->quoted)
  {
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (qop_param->value.str, \
                                               qop_param->value.len, \
                                               MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (qop_param->value.str, \
                                               qop_param->value.len, \
                                               MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_INT_))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH_INT;
  }
  else
  {
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_, \
                                         qop_param->value.str, \
                                         qop_param->value.len))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_INT_, \
                                         qop_param->value.str, \
                                         qop_param->value.len))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH_INT;
  }
  /* No know QOP has been detected */
  return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_INVALID;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function get_rq_dauth_qop:
struct MHD_RqDAuthParam
{
  /**
   * The string with length, NOT zero-terminated
   */
  struct _MHD_str_w_len value;
  /**
   * True if string must be "unquoted" before processing.
   * This member is false if the string is used in DQUOTE marks, but no
   * backslash-escape is used in the string.
   */
  bool quoted;
}
...
#define MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_ "auth"
...
#define MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_INT_ "auth-int"
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No compiler-specific language extensions were detected in the provided code. I checked for common, explicitly-documented compiler extensions such as: __attribute__ or __attribute__((...)), __extension__, typeof, __builtin_*, inline assembly (asm/__asm__), GCC statement-expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, anonymous structs/unions used as extensions, token-pasting tricks beyond standard macros, or other vendor-specific keywords. The backslashes seen at line ends are simple source line splices (preprocessor line splicing), which is standard C and not a compiler extension. Use of enum, static, const, pointer-to-const, bool (from stdbool.h), string macros, and function calls are all standard C features. Therefore there are no fragments that need investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
